questions.search: How do I sell something on Facebook marketplace?
questions.more: It's even more straightforward to post something to Facebook Marketplace. Click the Marketplace icon, then tap the 'Sell' or 'Sell something' button. Take a photo of your item (you can select more than one from your gallery), and click the 'Add Photos' option to upload them. Enter an item title, description and price.
questions.article_header: Facebook Selling Tips: Sell for free - when & how
questions.parent: how to sell items on facebook

children.search: What are the rules for Facebook marketplace?
children.more: Facebook Marketplace Rules Certain items cannot be sold. Facebook maintains a list of items that are not allowed to be sold on Marketplace. ... You must sell a physical item. ... The description of the item must match the image. ... Before-and-after pictures are prohibited.

children.search: How do I sell something on Facebook?
children.more: To sell something in a Facebook buy and sell group: From your News Feed, click Groups in the left menu and select the buy and sell group you'd like to sell something in. Click What are you selling? Enter the details about the item you're selling and click Next. Choose your audience. ... Click Post.

children.search: How do I sell something on the marketplace?
children.more: From facebook.com, click Marketplace in the left menu. Click + Sell Something, then click Item for Sale. Enter a title for your listing, the price, your location and a category for the item (example: Furniture, Baby & Kids). You can also add a description.

questions.search: How do you set up a selling page on Facebook?
questions.more: In order to sell through Facebook as a business, you will need a business page. Open your Facebook timeline and select the drop-down menu arrow in the top right corner. Select Manage Pages to view all of your active pages. Click Create a Page and set up a new business page for a selling profile through Facebook.Aug 15, 2018

questions.search: Can your friends see what you sell on Facebook?
questions.more: Hi Michelle, Products posted in Marketplace can be viewed by anyone with access to Marketplace. Products are not automatically published in a person's News Feed, and a person's friends will not be notified about the product unless the seller chooses to share it with them.

children.search: How can I see what someone is selling on Facebook?
children.more: Click an item you're selling. If all your items are marked as sold, click Show listings in the top right. Click your name. ... To see someone else's Marketplace profile: Click Marketplace in the left column of News Feed. Click an item you'd like to buy. Click the seller's name.

children.search: Can my friends see my Facebook ads?
children.more: Will my friends see it? Your ad will not run directly through your Facebook page, nor is it likely that you or your friends will see it. Your ad is not running directly as a post, but as an advertisement that will show up as part of the regular news feed on Facebook to a targeted audience.Apr 22, 2018

children.search: Can you see who viewed Facebook marketplace?
children.more: But the official word from Facebook is: No, there is no way to check who has viewed your Facebook profile. Facebook has confirmed this in an answer on their help center site, stating, “No, Facebook doesn't let people track who views their profile. Third-party apps also can't provide this functionality.”

children.search: How do I turn off selling feature on Facebook?
children.more: To turn the buy and sell group feature off: From facebook.com, click Groups in the left menu and select your group. Click More below your cover photo and select Edit Group Settings. Next to Group Type click Change. Select a different group type and click Confirm. Scroll down to the bottom and click Save.
